item.title: Cathie Wood: Current Unemployment Rate Exceeds Prior Cycle Peaks of 2008-2009, Signaling Rate Cuts Again
item.description: On September 7th, Cathie Wood, the CEO of ARK Invest, tweeted and said, "We anticipate that the productivity-driven prosperity we expect will shorten the duration of unemployment. However, the current unemployment rate is higher than the peak of each cycle before the 2008 - 2009 (crisis). This once again emphasizes the need for interest rate cuts."

item.title: Binance Alpha and Futures will list Avantis (AVNT)
item.description: On September 7th, Binance Alpha will list and commence trading for Avantis (AVNT) on September 9, 2025, at 21:00 (UTC+8). Furthermore, the Binance Futures platform will initiate the AVNTUSDT perpetual contract on September 9, 2025, at 23:00 (UTC+8), offering up to 50x leverage. All eligible Binance users will be entitled to a token airdrop. Eligible users must claim the airdrop through the Alpha activity page by using Alpha Points between September 9, 2025, at 21:00 (UTC+8) and September 10, 2025, at 21:00 (UTC+8).

item.title: Jupiter: JLP Liquidity Pool TVL Surpasses $2 Billion
item.description: On September 7th, Jupiter tweeted, "The TVL of the JLP Liquidity Pool has exceeded 2 billion US dollars."According to the data on the official website, the current JLP APY is 17.58%.

item.title: FutureCrest Acquisition, led by Tom Lee, has submitted an IPO application aiming to raise $250 million.
item.description: On September 7th, Tom Lee, the chairman of BitMine, led a blank check company (SPAC) named FutureCrest Acquisition. They submitted a filing to the U.S. SEC on Friday and planned to raise up to $250 million through an initial public offering (IPO).Tom Lee, who is known in the media for his optimistic views on cryptocurrency, also emphasized his previous Bitcoin price predictions in the IPO prospectus. FutureCrest Acquisition stated that when seeking acquisition targets, the company would leverage the management team's expertise and social capital in fields such as AI, digital assets, fintech, infrastructure, robotics, and communications. Additionally, the company is optimistic about opportunities in business intelligence, productivity software, and digital health.FutureCrest Acquisition plans to list on the Nasdaq under the stock symbol FCRSU. The company confidentially submitted its filings on August 5, 2025. Cantor Fitzgerald is the exclusive bookrunner for this transaction.

item.title: Bessant: Job Data Shows Trump's Criticism of Fed's Slow Action Was Right
item.description: On September 7th, US Treasury Secretary Yellen stated that the employment data indicates that Trump's criticism of the Fed's slow action was valid. The revised employment projections for 2024 may be reduced by 800,000 jobs. (FXStreet)

item.title: Michael Saylor once again shares Bitcoin Tracker information, hinting at another BTC purchase.
item.description: On September 7th, Michael Saylor, the founder of Strategy, once again shared information related to the Bitcoin Tracker and stated, "Require more orange." According to the previous pattern, Strategy always discloses additional Bitcoin purchase information on the second day after such news is released.

item.title: Polkadot will release important news tomorrow
item.description: On September 7th, the Polkadot team said, "There will be a significant release the day after tomorrow."

item.title: Tether CEO: Has Not Sold BTC, Will Continue to Invest Part of Profits in Bitcoin, Gold, Land, and Other Safe Assets
item.description: On September 7th, Paolo Ardoino, the CEO of Tether, responded to the statement "Tether is selling Bitcoin in exchange for gold" on the X platform. He said, "Tether has not sold any Bitcoin. Instead, it has allocated a portion of its Bitcoin reserves to the XXI project. Tether will continue to invest a portion of its profits in secure assets like Bitcoin, gold, and land. Tether is a stable company."

item.title: Analysis: The August market slowdown trend may continue in the short term, even as the market anticipates the Fed will cut interest rates in September
item.description: On September 7th, Binance Research presented its September cryptocurrency trend report, indicating that in August, the cryptocurrency market witnessed a slight cooling with a total market capitalization decline of 1.7%. Both Bitcoin and Ethereum retraced from their peaks. As capital shifted towards alternative coins, Bitcoin's dominance further decreased to 57.3%, while Ethereum's dominance increased to 14.2%. Corporate funds started to flow into Ethereum. Furthermore, historically, September has been a month with relatively weak performance in the crypto market. Therefore, even though the market is closely monitoring the possibility of a Fed rate cut, the slowdown trend in the crypto market may persist in the short term.

item.title: Analyst: Bitcoin is in a consolidation phase, slightly biased towards a bullish outlook
item.description: On September 7th, CryptoQuant analyst Axel Adler Jr. put out a post stating, "This week, the Bitcoin market entered a 'consolidation' stage. The price consolidated within the range of $110,000 to $112,000, near the crucial support level. Derivative sellers lost their dominance, yet the upward momentum remains feeble. On-chain indicators indicate a decrease in activity, while exchanges witnessed positive net outflows. In the macro environment, yields are on the decline, and the US labor market is soft, providing support for risk assets. The market is in a consolidation phase, slightly inclined towards a cautious uptrend, but it remains highly sensitive to inflation data and options expiry."
